reviews.sentence: Older building with updated rooms. was not too impressed with lobby or the swimming pool that was right next to the lobby. Having the pool visible like that is good or bad depending if you care if people watch you while they are checking in. But staff were very friendly and helpful. it is been a while since I have stayed at a Holiday in. This one must have just recently had its rooms updated. The room is a little unique with hard wood floors. Bathroom nice and crazy bright with a light surrounding the mirror. Floors were warm and cozy and fixtures are nice. Beds comfy and warm. Work desk decent simple but very functional. With lots of power options throughout room. Also an outlet next to each bed is a nice touch. Fridge available under TV and a coffee pod system. But machine already had water in it and I did not have a way to flush it. Not knowing how long it was in there or who put the liquid in there concerned me a bit. But I made my coffee anyways and it tasted a bit like plastic. In retrospect I should have run it once without anything in it. Air conditioner was a separate box under window that made a little noise but I have had much worse. Overall I was very happy with my stay.

Rooms in older section need upgrading. Staff friendly some helpful some novices clueless had an older non renovated room with worn sink and tub fixtures that need replacement room generally comfortable heating system worked on cold nights good. Business center computer outdated could not print boarding pass but night manager let me print in his office good man. Lots of bar traffic but not noisy. OK for the price not outstanding value in older rooms will ask for renovated room if I stay here again or will look elsewhere. Quiet comfortable room. Near main highway and shopping including Wal Mart. Bathroom fixtures in older room need replacement.
A bit out dated. Toilet had large crack in it. sink was visably repaired. bathroom door needed replacing as coming apart from moisture. I have stayed here before in a newer room and it was fine.

Very comfortable Stay. Rooms in the tower were great. Was there over 2 weeks and had no issues at all. Comfortable king size bed microwave fridge heated bathroom floors. Newly renovated and great staff. Heard lots of complaints about the rooms not in the tower but did not affect my stay. Had room service a couple of nights and the food was excellent. Laundry facilities were not the best and quite a long walk to get there but at least they had them. Staff was friendly and helpful and would get you anything you needed. Would definitely recommend this place but just make sure to get a room in the tower.
Great service great room. The room was beautiful much more updated and modern. Loved the bathroom and the heated floor. Bed was a tad harder than my liking but I am not everyone.

Spacious Modern Rooms in Great Location. The spacious modern rooms with large functional bathrooms are better than average. Very comfortable beds ample room amenities and quiet AC make this a great choice for short or long stays. Plenty of shopping and restaurant choices in the vicinity. Service is great and it is obvious they are committed to ensuring your stay is a pleasant one.
This hotel was clean and everything was clean bathroom was very small and hard to get into shower but other than that it was a great place to lay my head.

Great Hotel. wonderful reception staff and such a clean place to stay. The redone rooms have nice flooring and comfortable beds. The housekeeping staff brought up a crib for my grand daughter and an extra blanket for her. The salt water pool was wonderfully cool and the hot tub a perfect temperature. The breakfast in the morning was great and the server was quick at clean up and bringing the bill. The food was good. It is a perfect location to the highways and biways of the City. The bathrooms were lovely. I would recommend this hotel.
Attended an event here and also stayed in one of the rooms. The room was gorgeous and the pool and hot tub were fun. However the jets in the hot tub have not been working for some time.
The room was nice for a working professional. Lots of amenities nearby. Breakfast was nice.

Overall a nice comfortable stay. We a family of 4 had a nice comfortable stay a convenient location a quiet room comfortable beds tasty breakfast nice indoor outdoor pools etc. We stayed in a room in an older side of the building not in the Tower and noticed it needs lots of updating but I guess the room rates reflect that. A good thing about an older building is that there was a balcony that we can step out for fresh air. I had an issue with the laundry facility it was out of laundry detergent and because it is run by a different company the hotel staff could not help. The front desk was pleasant but reluctant to break down a bill into small changes so I went to a nearby bank to get coins for laundry and tip. We will bring lots of coins and laundry detergent next time. The location was great just off the highway and a mall with a nice food court was nearby. The breakfast was awesome and the pools were fun. it is right off the highway and a mall was nearby lots of choices for dinner from a food court to a high end restaurant. The laundry facility needs a better management and the bathroom floor in our room upon check in was not clean found lots of hair on the floor.

Oktoberfest Party Central Wing of the Hotel. We booked a room for 2 nights at the hotel as we were in Kitchener for a family wedding. Two of my brothers were also at the hotel and were given rooms closer to the front of the hotel in the tower portion of the complex. My wife and were given a room room 132 much more expensive than my brothers rooms way down at the back part of complex. Over the course of the late afternoon and early evening it appeared that lots of party type people were starting to arrive in our wing of the hotel complex which is quite far from the rest of the hotel. Between 1030 pm and 110 pm I had to call the front desk twice to complain about people yelling screaming in the hallways and doors slamming up and down the corridor. On the first call I told them I wanted to be moved. They said the hotel was completley booked up and there were no available rooms but that the manager was on the way down. She never showed up and the noise continued. I called back. I was assured that security was on site and on their way to handle the situation. Again no one showed up. By 115 I had to get dressed and walk down to the main desk to get some action. The manager on duty had no clue what I was talking about. His security person was standing at the front desk. I walked back down to the party wing with him. At that time he started to knock on doors to get people to setledown. That seemed to have worked for the first night. On the second night we arrived back at the hotel just after midnight. It was mostly quiet. I was pleasantly surprised. Well that did not last too long. Between 10 am and 230 am the shuttle bus arrived back from the Kitchener Waterloo Oktoberfest celebrations. I knew this because you could clearly hear people yelling in the hallway that the Oktoberfest bus is here. Woho. After the first night I spoke to the front desk people who pretty much patted me on th head and said everything would be fine on the second night because security was on site and would handle any disturbances. In short not impressed at all for the over priced rate I paid and being dumped in middle of a large group who had clearly come to party and that managment gave no consideration after I repeatedly complianed about the disturbances.

A very comfortable stay at Holiday Inn Kitchener. After a long drive it was a pleasure to check into the Holiday Inn Kitchener and get a room without a reservation. Our room was clean cozy and spacious. We especially enjoyed the sauna swimming pool and jacuzi. This Holiday Inn property is easy to navigate around as it is the perfect size. In the summer months the outdoor pool is open. An extra perk was the free coffee at the entrance of the restaurant. Staying at the Holiday Inn Kitchener is a nice way to get some peace and relaxation before venturing onto the cosmopolitan city of Toronto.

Exceeded our Expectations. we had reserved our room ahead of time as we were attending a wedding end of September. I thought I had previously left a review but think I rated the wrong location. Everything went perfectly the room was spotlessly clean the desk clerks were very helpful and friendly and made us feel welcome. we are looking forward to another trip to Kitchener and will definitely book a room with you again. Thank You.

Clean rooms and friendly staff. I stayed in the older part of the hotel so the rooms were a little dated but the beds were comfortable and the room was clean. The biggest issue I had was the height of the showerhead. I am 6 ft and it was almost chest level. The balcony doors were a little awkward as well extremely heavy and locking mechanisms in disrepair.

Not good. Well the hot tub was completely boarded up with absolutely no notice or anything that it was closed. pool was freezing the indoors one. Bed was uncomfortable and than well the bathroom was so small you had to open the door to even get to the shower tub than close it to get into it. The fan did n’t work so because of the size it got extremely steamy so all in All it was terrible oh plus you had to walk threw the lobby to even get to the indoor pool.

They offer two types of rooms at similar prices. In Dec2016 I stayed in the tower rooms but this time I decided to get the other ones considering the price was similar. These other rooms not tower are smaller dated noisy a c unit stains of rust in the bathroom uneven mattresses and poor housekeeping. I now understand that those rooms are way worst than the tower rooms but I am sure they should way cheaper.

Disappointing service. I was very disappointed at the service I received. I had requested a late check out on a Sunday morning and was told it was n’t available. I requested to pay for a late check out and was told it was also not available. Being a frequent guest at that hotel I was very disappointed in the service. We booked a room at another hotel for Sunday that we were very happy with and will be staying there in the future. I will never stay at this holiday inn in the future due to the service. Being a duty manager at another IHG property this property fell short of IHG standards.

They have renovated lots of rooms. As soon as I got there they offered me one of their renovated rooms. The rooms are very clean and equipped with everything you need. The staffs are very nice and helpful. The breakfast was great. It was fresh and really good. One of the best I have had in hotels I have stayed in the past.

It served the purpose but was a bit of a let down. The pool area was run down. The lockers were rusted out in the changing room. The indoor pool area was just not up to par with other hotels. Having children we rely on the pool area for evening entertainment but we were not comfortable staying in the water to long due to water looking murky and a smell of dampness but not a normal pool area smell. We ended up staying in the older part of the hotel and it smelled musty. When I originally looked at pictures of the hotel I saw many modern rooms and I just assumed that was where we would be.

Breakfast is n’t free like advertised. The king size room did n’t have a pull out sofa like the ad said so we had to change rooms. Complimentary breakfast is n’t complimentary charged us 50Had to pay for the “ free ” breakfast.

BEWARE. Made a wrong decision when I decided to book a room at The Sunbridge Hotel Conference Center in Kitchener Holiday Inn still do not know what it is was not listed as a Holiday Inn on website even though their receipt has Holiday Inn heading. It was one of the worse experiences I have had at a hotel. Not knowing weather or not it was a Holiday Inn or a Sunbridge was my first mistake and also thinking it would be a nice place to stay was my second. The problem started the morning of August 15th when we went down for the breakfast I had paid 20 extra for. Thinking at that price it would include bacon and eggs and toast but what we received was totally pathetic. It was very small with cereal stale bread stale pastries a few slices of roast beef and a couple of other meats that tasted disgusting along with a few cubes of cheese and small servings of yogourt. Upon our arrival we were informed that there was no wifi available which was no big problem and they mentioned breakfast would be served up until 930 and we would sign for our breakfast but failed to mention that the kitchen was under renovations and that it was a VERY limited buffet. When I checked out I complained about this and it fell on deaf ears on top of that I was NOT charged the amount that I signed for or that what was CONFIRMED on my reservation. The reservation confirmation stated Room Rates Starting 08142019. CAD 1240Subtotal CAD 1240Total Tax CAD 2108Total CAD 14508 But when I got my receipt my credit card was charged 15332 again falling on deaf ears as they added more taxes than stated on a confirmation which is false advertising and I have contacted the better business bureau about this matter as the front desk agent would not listen to my complaints and was very rude and uncaring that I was so frustrated by that time I walked out I did not ask to speak to the manager again it probably would not have helped. I found this hotel not forthcoming with their problems and not willing to refund the extra money that I had paid for their so called 22 dollar breakfast. I really wish I had of kept my reservation at the Quality Inn where I have stayed before and they actually had a great breakfast well worth the extra money but they include it in their rates. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and if you do stay here WATCH OUT for the hidden costs that they stick on when you check out.

It ’s no longer a holiday inn its a SunBridge aka Hilton in September. p do you not stay here go across the road at the Radison Hotel superclean the food is superb and the people are very nice PS I phone the hotel to get a room and sure enough they Were n’t blocked. Unfortunately I got to give it one star To be able to post this Also spoke to very nice lady at head office at the Hilton. And apologize. And said it was n’t a Hilton yet and might not be if inspections do n’t go well. She felt so bad for me and she did n’t have to do this she offered to give me five days and one of the Hilton hotels I asked for the one in Niagara falls September long weekend put me on hold for a minute came back that is all booked up double bed rooms and said there was one room that was n’t and it was. The presidential suite wow was n’t expecting this.

So horrible surprised my kids for a night away picked a hotel with outdoor pool pictures showed a hot tub. There was no outdoor pool or hot tub. The indoor pool was very cold. Went down for complimentary breakfast. Sat down lady asked if for our to number we asked of there was a charge. As it was just cereal and toast. She said no. Could barely speak English. Then brought us a bill for 450. ridiculous Would never recomend this hotel everyone is very rude and false advertising.

Exceptional. I like the cleanness of the room and bathroom. Coffee machine and the fridge. The pillow is little bit harder and cause the pain on my neck. I had to use towels as pillow. My husband is fine with the pillow.

Enjoyed my stay it was relaxing and comfortable. I loved the size of the room and the comfortable chair and bed. It was a very restful room and quiet. I was across from the elevator and did not hear the coming and goings of others. The tv control was not very good it was a very cheap plastic one that did not always respond when pressing the numbers. The bathroom is marvelous but the toilet paper is quite far from the toilet itself I could see someone shorter than I having a problem. It was quite a stretch.
The hotel and rooms are very niceJust a lot of noise from the traffic.
Perfect. The area was very clean staff were wonderful management was thoughtful heated bathroom floors and comfy bed. Would’ve been nice to have a small games room with a pool table shuffleboard etc.
The room i stayed in was ok not that clean. The toilet keep running unles you jiggled the handle. The shower faucet was loose.
Did n’t like the fact that I could hear the noise in adjacent room all night however room was clean and modern and staff wonderful.
